comments.commentBody:
The President has the authority and responsibility to thwart a threat of any kind to the stability of the nation. In the present crisis, he would be well advised to unilaterally direct the Treasury to do whatever is necessary to maintain the fiscal integrity of the United States, including the issuance of appropriate debt instruments.

This action will bring howls of anger from the ranks of some politicians. They are the same politicians who have taken the nation's finances hostage and have resorted to fiscal death threats to attain their personal commitments.

They are using terrorist tactics and they should be treated as such. Actually, many of those involved may be glad to be relieved of their impossible mission.

If President Obama is concerned by the legality of this approach he should read the Op Ed piece (NYT, July 22, 2011) by Professors Posner of the University of Chicago and Vermeule of Harvard University. Abraham Lincoln actually nullified Habeas Corpus during the Civil War, and FDR stated he would take extra legal action if necessary during the Great Depression.

Barak Obama is well justified in overriding the debt ceiling during the present Great Recession in order to save the country from financial collapse.

How dare Boehner claim the White House has moved the goalposts??? That is all the Republicans have been doing the entire time the President has been in office. Obama has compromised again and again (too much in my estimate) and the Republicans don't want to give up anything that will negatively affect their rich constituents. "Job creators" my foot! Since taxes on the wealthy are at a 50 year low, why aren't we seeing any jobs created?

Here's the Facebook profile of the suspected Oslo perp:

"It listed his religion as Christian, politics as conservative. It said he enjoys hunting."

I'm starting to think that guns, god, and conservative politics is a very evil combination. Our economy is about to be blown up, and the whole country seems like it's hostage to a handful of republicans in Congress.
Why is nobody talking about cutting salaries of all Congress members?  That would fit with the "smaller government" mantra.  They are worth about the minimum wage since they accomplish NOTHING!!!!!
I've never been a fan of parliamentary government, but I sure would like an election right now.

I'm not an Obama apologist by any means. I didn't think he had the experience to be President, and I never saw why people thought he was a progressive. I thought he was the most conservative of all the Democratic candidates. But even though he might be a Republican in Democrat clothing, he is not a domestic terrorist as some of the Republicans have turned into.
And Boehner. Not returning the president's calls? Rude and yes, racist. Our congressman is Timothy Johnson, Republican. He's been an OK congressman and I've even voted for him once, but I'll be actively campaigning against him now. I understand what Obama is trying to do, even though I don't agree with it. I don't know what the Republicans are trying to do. I'd like to just recall everyone.
So we are about to face economic collapse, and he takes his toys and goes home. Unbelievable!

So, the Republicans have painted themselves into a corner, and now anything they do will benefit the Democrats.  They just are trying to decide now what will benefit the Democrats the least.  And the country?  Who cares about that?

Ever since President Obama was elected all the Republicans want to do is see him and his administration fail.  Because of their crazy political ideology they are willing to take down the government and the American people with it.  I cannot believe that we as a people are so apathetic to allow this to happen.  We should be out on the Washington Mall protesting like we did when we wanted out of Vietnam.

I think it is now clear that the Republicans are disingenuous and that this game of chicken is designed to hurt Obama by inflicting hardship on Americans in order to blame him and win back the White House in 2012.  It's diabolical.  That said, it is time for the Democrats to play hardball.  I never thought I would live to wish that LBJ was still around.
The Republicans want to destroy our current form of government and usher in a corporate takeover.
Theater -- badly written, acted, directed, and  produced. Makes the Spiderman  musical look  positively brilliant  by comparison.

John Boehner is a true American and wants to do the right thing. Obama does not really care about this country and the long term future of this country. He is pandering to special interest groups who will support his feeble attempt at getting reelected. Obama talks a good game but it means nothing. In the long run Boehner will win.

It's astonishing to me that the American state is so eager to demolish itself - with not one protest on the Mall in Washington.

I guess Obama will raise the debt ceiling himself - but if that doesn't work, hello Depression.

Guess people have to feel the pain before they wake up. Wow, I never knew so called educated people could be so foolish...just astonishing.

Bad Boehner letter! I'd expect more from a man of his experience and stature. I can only hope he delegated it to a young intern, maybe a first assignment in big, bad Washington. He's not a statesman at all. He's just a tea party panderer. There's no hope.
The rich don't want to pay taxes like the rest of us, they want to take the money from Medicare and Social Security.  Are you going to stand by and let them get away with it?
It is now clear that the most extreme, lunatic far right, anarchist segment of the Republican party represented by Bachmann is in control of the House.
I'm glad our nation's rulers behave like middle school girls.

I see an Empire in decline. With all the posturing, the careful hairdo's and the soundbites, the CNN moments, people's lives are being ruined. No one outside of the US understands how the dumbest people in the land end up in Washington. Amazing.

The President should just use the 14th Amendment to raise the debt ceiling. I've had enough of these nut-job, right-wing terrorists and traitors that make up the Confederate -- oops, I mean Republican -- party.

GOP House Speaker John A. Boehner is totally incapable of delivering votes from his own party because his party is made out of congressmen, who will not accept a black President.

Let us default so that we can rebuilt this country from real Ground Zero.

I hope that the folks that voted these bozos in last November are happy.
26.2
Good grief Republicans quit being so stupid!  It's getting old and dangerous to our economy.
Start by hitting them where it hurts. No. 1: cease Federal subsidies for ethanol, and stop paying other farm subsidies. That would probably put the budget back in the black.

The Russians should have finished the job and saved us from their export that effectively made them win the Cold War, Ayn Rand.  Welcome to the world of the dark Russian lady that now runs your country, you once proud Americans.  Forget the Founding Fathers, they are but an alliteration that looks good on the mantles of the Republicans of today.  And forget God, for He is just a tool in their bag of domination toys.  Ayn Rand is their god, their reason for their existence.  The dark Russian did what Russian leaders from Stalin, on, could not do, bring this country to its knees.  The apostles of Ayn Rand have won the war it seems.  Norquist, where is your soul?
